content.text: Showing all necessary working, solve the equation \(4x - 11x^{\frac{1}{2}} + 6 = 0.\)
A line has equation \(y = x + 1\) and a curve has equation \(y = x^{2} + bx + 5\). Find the set of values of the constant \(b\) for which the line meets the curve. [4]
Find the equation of the line through the origin parallel to \(AB\)
The length of the line \(AB\) is \(3\frac{1}{3}\) units. Find the value of \(a\)
Two points \(A\) and \(B\) have coordinates \((3a, - a)\) and \((- a, 2a)\) respectively, where \(a\) is a positive constant
For the case where the series is an arithmetic progression, find the sum of the first 80 terms. [3]
For the case where the series is a geometric progression, find the sum to infinity. [2]
The first term of a series is 6 and the second term is 2
Show that the equation
may be expressed as \(9\cos^2\theta - 22\cos \theta + 4 = 0.\)
Hence solve the equation
for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant \theta \leqslant 360^{\circ}\)
Find the value of \(a\)
Find the equation of the curve
Determine, showing all necessary working, the nature of the stationary point. [2]
A curve has a stationary point at (3, \(9\frac{1}{2}\)) and has an equation for which \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = ax^2 + a^2 x\), where \(a\) is a non-zero constant
Find the value of \(k\)
Verify that the curve meets the line \(y = x\) again when \(x = 5\)
Find, showing all necessary working, the area of the shaded region
The diagram shows part of the curve with equation \(y = k(x^{3} - 7x^{2} + 12x)\) for some constant \(k\). The curve intersects the line \(y = x\) at the origin \(O\) and at the point \(A\) (2, 2)
Find \(\overrightarrow{DF}\)
Find the unit vector in the direction of \(\overrightarrow{EF}\)
Use a scalar product to find angle \(EFD\)

The diagram shows a solid figure \(OABCDEF\) having a horizontal rectangular base \(OABC\) with \(OA = 6\) units and \(AB = 3\) units. The vertical edges \(OF\), \(AD\) and \(BE\) have lengths 6 units, 4 units and 4 units respectively. Unit vectors \(\mathbf{i}\), \(\mathbf{j}\) and \(\mathbf{k}\) are parallel to \(OA\), \(OC\) and \(OF\) respectively

The diagram shows a triangle \(OAB\) in which angle \(ABO\) is a right angle, angle \(AOB = \frac{1}{2}\pi\) radians and \(AB = 5 \text{ cm}\). The arc \(BC\) is part of a circle with centre \(A\) and meets \(OA\) at \(C\). The arc \(CD\) is part of a circle with centre \(O\) and meets \(OB\) at \(D\). Find the area of the shaded region. [8]
Find and simplify the equation of the normal through \(A\)
Find the \(x\)-coordinate of the point where this normal meets the curve again. [3]

A point is moving along the curve in such a way that as it passes through \(A\) its \(x\)-coordinate is decreasing at the rate of 0.3 units per second. Find the rate of change of its \(y\)-coordinate at \(A\)
A curve has equation \(y = \frac{1}{2} (4x - 3)^{-1}\). The point \(A\) on the curve has coordinates \(\left(1, \frac{1}{2}\right)\)
State the greatest possible value of \(a\)
It is given that \(a\) takes this greatest possible value. State the range of f and find an expression for \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}(x)\)
The one-one function f is defined by \(\operatorname {f}(x) = (x - 3)^2 - 1\) for \(x < a\), where \(a\) is a constant
Show that \(\mathrm{gg}(2x)\) can be expressed in the form \((2x - 3)^4 + b(2x - 3)^2 + c\), where \(b\) and \(c\) are constants to be found
Hence expand \(\mathrm{gg}(2x)\) completely, simplifying your answer
The function g is defined by \(\mathrm{g}(x) = (x - 3)^2\) for \(x \geqslant 0\)
